oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Mickey Gilley Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Mickey Gilley (performer) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mickey Gilley; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Mickey Gilley discusses receiving Larry Butler's "She Reminded Me of You" and its haunting melody -- (00:57) "You've Still Got A Way With My Heart" is described by Gilley as a lifetime of memories and hopes for it's acceptance -- (01:45) Biff Collie and Gilley discuss what caused a turn in his musical career -- (02:58) Gilley compares himself to his cousin, Jerry Lee Louis, and how he was stuck to the label that, "He was Louis"; It would take a push to change the image -- (04:24) Gilley reflects on Jim Ed Brown pushing him to try new types of songs: "You Don't Know Me" and "That's All That Matters to Me" -- (05:08) Gilley talks about Butler's musical career and working with Butler in the studio -- (05:53) Gilley's "Chasin' Rainbows" is reflected on by Gilley as an undervalued track about life -- (07:13) Gilley talks about Butler pushing Gilley away from his style into trying "Me and the Blues" -- (08:05) Collie asks Gilley about ballads and Gilley tells about the diversity of entertainment in his live shows -- (09:42) Gilley talks about the 'Urban Cowboy' craze and being unable to perform every tune of his -- (10:43) Gilley discusses his structure for working a live show and playing for the president -- (12:11) Gilley reflects on remakes -- (13:17) Gilley tells a story of a man refusing to allow Jerry Lee Louis to record his song -- (13:58) Gilley calls a tune [Unidentified] a great love song misconceived as a "bubblegum song" -- (15:07) Gilley tells of how most songs he has are ballads and his decision on his single tracks -- (16:37) Gilley calls a song his "opening song" and reflects on the energy of the song -- (17:15) Gilley talks about how he makes quips about flower songs and how women take offense to "Don't the Girls All Get Prettier At Closing Time"; Gilley says the song is meant to be non sex based -- (18:36) "Overnight Sensation" by Gilley is called "filthy" by Gilley and he reflects on trying to be more bold -- (19:46) Gilley reflects on how he wishes he could bring a wider range to a tune [Unidentified] -- (20:36)"Couldn't Love Have Picked a Better Place to Die" by Gilley is said to be a reflection of a location eternally changed -- (21:40) Gilley thinks his album Chasing Rainbows is his top LP -- (22:02) Gilley shows appreciation to Collie -- (22:11) Collie reflects on the grandeur of having Gilley and Gilley talks about thinking of his image as a mimic of Jerry Lee Louis
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Gilley, Mickey; Collie, Biff;
